website_summaries.verdict: While its narrow deck means more passes are required to finish the lawn, this battery-powered mower handles smaller yards well and can tackle higher grass, too.
pros: Works well on smaller lawns less than a quarter acre
Batteries are interchangeable with those from other Black+Decker lithium-ion powered lawn tools, and charge quickly
Users like the single lever for setting mower height
cons: Folding handle can be difficult to set up initially
Batteries drain quickly and must be changed after about 20 minutes of regular use
Tends to struggle in thicker or longer grass

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is way too short and have to constantly empty the bag.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is way too short and have to constantly empty the bag. I have a small yard, but both batteries quit before I even finish. Then, they're too hot to recharge. I had a corded B&D mower and I loved it! Had it for nearly 20 years. I was hoping to get the same quality with this one, but no. It was also very difficult to assemble. I am very much disappointed in this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Spot

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst. Not great.
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn't start for a while. We finally got it to start. It died a few times but would start again. Our lawn is not big or very tall. The battery, fully charged, lasted about 15 minutes at best, which was a bummer. Especially since it is advertised at 45 minutes per battery. It does mow the grass fine, but only in 15 minute intervals then waiting 3 hours for the battery to recharge. goes over small sticks with no real issue. Would NOT buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sessa

customer_reviews.title: Works on high grass!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using manual push mowers for years. I have a small lawn and use that to get a good workout. With COVID I spend allot of time away from the city and in my cabin in the country. So I don’t mow the grass for 2-3 weeks! With grass that high I can’t use the manual push mower. So I got this B&D electric mower to cut it when the grass is high. In my PICs you can see 2 weeks worth of grass Getting cut nice in just one pass. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use, good for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Light, and easy to maneuver (especially because you're not dragging around a cord, and trying to ensure that it doesn't get under the blade!). Cuts well, and pretty close to the edge. Easy to remove the bag for emptying. We have 2 smallish lawns, and I can do both on one fully-charged battery. Not as powerful as gas, but you avoid the noise / fumes / startup problems (with this, you hold the button down, lift the bale, and bingo). Another benefit compared to gas is that you can lay it on its side to clean underneath (or remove / sharpen the blade) without worrying about the gas leaking out.
customer_reviews.author: SDR

customer_reviews.title: cordless lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this machine. just press the button and it starts and goes. I bought this because I got tired of paying my gardener every month to just mow a 10x30 area. . No more gas and pulling the string to start the lawnmower. I am 57 years young and I am really enjoying it, it is so easy to use. I also own the black & decker edger and blower and use only 1 rechargeable battery for this area. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rubensgranny

customer_reviews.title: Seems cheaply made compared to the previous model.
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as the previous model I have. I needed a new battery since I got less mowing time from when I bought it 5 years ago. The brand changed to a different type. 2 batteries to charge. 15 minutes per battery. Very cheaply made compared to my previous sturdy model. The handles keep moving around so it’s kind of annoying having to keep fixing it. Nice handle on the mower it’s self that’s meant to move lawn mower around since the handle is so flimsy. I used it to lift over the door threshold. Unlike my previous sturdy handle mower I can just push with the handle
customer_reviews.author: Empty nester

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work - box shreds getting lawnmower out - had to buy new box to ship back.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work. Neither battery worked. It was difficult to assemble - directions were unclear. This is a waste of money - and I had to pay for a new box to ship it back because you have to tear the box apart to get everything out. I will be shopping for lawnmowers at my local hardware store from now on so if something like this happens, returns are easy. I'm a frequent amazon shopper, but this one was an epic fail on all fronts.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Mann

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how well this works
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical about an electric lawnmower as I had never used one but this thing rocks. Plenty of power to get the job done. Love the batteries too. They charge very quickly and each last about 30 mins. Updated 7/31/17: Still love my little lawnmower and works great. I recently discovered that it also works great as a mulching mower. Just take the bag off and go to town. Keep in mind that I have a small yard and never let the grass get too long. Would be difficult to mulch mow if you let your grass get too high but works great if you keep it fairly short.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Becker

customer_reviews.title: This is an absolutely perfect and fantastic mower for my yard (which is small)
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely perfect and fantastic mower for my yard (which is small). Has a handle to load in my storage building, isn't too heavy. Complete yard done with one battery, great cut, quiet, wish I'd had this mower years ago. Makes cutting grass much easier than trying to get a gas mower to start, dealing with oil, spark plugs, etc. I hate maintenance on gas engines and this requires none.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley aka Dogsonly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mower!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is PERFECT. I wanted a mower I could use when my husband wasn't around to start our gas mover for me ( shoulder injury = I can't risk it..) This mower is lightweight to push around, the batteries charge quickly, and I have never needed a whole battery to cut our small lawn. And no gross gas smell! Love it! I will say I got mine on Amazon for 1/4 the usual price because it was used. It took some figuring out to assemble, but it was worth saving the $250 bucks! Be sure to look for "other offers!"
customer_reviews.author: Bethysue332

customer_reviews.title: It's a good mower but I wish it was a bit broader
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time installing the handle. It's simple but there is no manual to follow.The rubber guard which is on the back between the mower and the grass bag has torn off within a month's time. It's a good mower but I wish it was a bit broader. It comes with two batteries but they don't provide enough juice to mow our entire lawn which is around 2000 sq ft. So I have to do the mowing in two sessions.
customer_reviews.author: breezer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small putting green, but not your small lawn
customer_reviews.text: Batteries overheat quickly and run out of juice even quicker. Took six full charges to finish an overgrown small lawn. The motor cannot push through anything that isn't short, neatly-trimmed grass and the bag is so small that it will take over a dozen bags to fill up a normal-sized outdoor compost bin. I'm glad my electric mower doesn't make my garage stink like gas, but man, I wish I had a gas mower sometimes...
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good used mower is junk
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in March as a used very good item now it time to use it. The manual is not for this model. Part of the underside of the deck has been removed and the screws to reattach it are missing .big problem is the deck has a 3” tear right where the wheel attaches. The deck is junk. This item is outside the return window and unusable
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Seckel

customer_reviews.title: Great small lawn mover!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cutting a small lawn area around my patio and pool. This is perfect for tight quarters and maneuvering around lawn furniture. Easy to assemble. Within 10 minutes I was cutting grass. I have 3 other 40v Black and Decker power equipment and have not been disappointed. Easy to adjust height. Collection bag also easy to install and works great. I am very happy with this mover.
customer_reviews.author: BNLDAVID

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mower so far
customer_reviews.text: We had a CMM1000 for 11 years and it worked great! The battery grew weaker and since the motor had that much age I researched replacements. We got the CM1640. It is tons lighter and the battery is not only replaceable; it's really, really light. The tires look like those on a toy. Then we started it...wow! Then I mowed the lawn and it is great so far! The only down side is where the handle attach to the mower feels a but flimsy but overall it's far easier to push, the motor sounds like it means business, the battery seemed like it was ready to mow the lawn all over again when I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Dilton

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I use four batteries at a time but it still worth it to not have to deal with gas. Since I hate cutting grass and I let it get really high before I cut it it's amazing what this battery operated lawn mower will go through with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: kristi senneff

customer_reviews.title: Okay mower, but the bag will not stay on.
customer_reviews.text: This is okay unless you let the grass get too high before you decide to cut it. I always put one battery in the charger as soon as I take one batter out, to put into the mower. The biggest problem I have had is that there is no way to secure the bag for grass clippings. It just sort of hangs there and falls off at the slightest jolt. If I use the mower without the bag, I have to keep stopping to lift it above the mounds of grass that drop out. What is the bloody point of including a grass bag if it cannot be secured?
customer_reviews.author: Bookish1

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mower (16-inch cordless) for 2 years now. It is perfect for my small front and back lawns. A fully charged battery is just enough to do both lawns if the grass isn't too long. But it can also handle pretty long grass--I was surprised at how good the performance is for a cordless mower. The bag design and is different than most mowers I have seen, but not bad once you are used to it. All the other aspects of it are very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Blythe_Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric lawn mover, just make sure you purchase another battery, so you can swap out once it starts dying. I purchased a spare battery for that purpose. Also I love how quiet this machine is...my neighbors say its more quieter than a vacuum cleaner..
customer_reviews.author: larry smith

customer_reviews.title: Suspension broke on fourth use due to bad weld. Mower service centers are few and far between.
customer_reviews.text: I was using this for the 4th time when suddenly the back end dropped to the ground and started scraping the grass. Upon inspection, a weld had let go between the wheel height adjustment cam lever and the rod connecting the two rear wheel suspensions. This is less than two months from purchase. Either poor engineering or poor manufacturing practice. Figured I could take it to a local service center, but the nearest one for lawn and garden equipment is over an hour and a half away. So, 6 hours+ of driving to drop off and then pick up after it's fixed. I'll never buy Black and Decker again.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Average for Me
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I'm underwhelmed after reading the reviews posted here. At first I was pleased with the mower however using it a few times I realized that the battery wouldn't last as long and even though I have a small yard the thicker grass I have is just too much for this little guy to handle. If you have a more sparse type of grass and a smaller yard this would be great for you to mow on a budget. For me, it wasn't really enough. Average rating IMO
customer_reviews.author: cramseyio

customer_reviews.title: Love This Little Beast!
customer_reviews.text: For years I've had others do lawn service for me this year I had a struggle with anybody bothering to call me back and give me a quote so I took a plunge and ordered this lawn mower it was the best thing I've ever done for myself! It's a whopping 38 lb and I am 98 lb and I can push it and it kills the Big Tall Grass I love it don't hesitate buy this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Marie

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once but it worked great! Way better than I expected. Battery lasted pretty well but it's definitely for a smaller lawn even though there is a 2nd battery. It's light and maneuvers much better than a gas mower. I'm very happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: dbnative

customer_reviews.title: Weak motor, small bag, Nice and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This mower is fairly weak and chokes on grass that's not very long at all. The bag that comes with it will fill in less than a minute or two of pushing. If you maintain your lawn often without bagging and don't mind having to restart it a couple times due to it choking on the grass it'll do the job. Otherwise I would not recommend it for anyone with anything larger than a tiny yard. Very quiet, rechargable batteries. Handle construction kind of crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Whispers

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower
customer_reviews.text: Works well and as advertised so far.....only had it several weeks. Had a Greenworks for two weeks that would not start after week 2. Customer service was horrible . So I sent it back and got this mower. Would recommend this one as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I like using this mower because it so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like using this mower because it so easy to use. I just charge the battery, push the button and go. However, it needs to be used weekly before the grass gets taller, especially in the summer. It has a hard time cutting longer grass.due to its small size. It keeps stalling and stopping constantly. But overall, I stopped having a lawn service and have been using it weekly...
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: ... guy for three summers and it is still working great with a few repairs
customer_reviews.text: I have had this guy for three summers and it is still working great with a few repairs. Haven't paid for gas to cut my lawn since. I have only had to replace the blade and glue a side on back on that broke. Now this is still pretty good because i have a lawn on a hill with woods and weeds all over the place. I use and abuse this guy and its still going. If it had about 30% more power it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan F8

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Weight Mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower is easy to use and extremely light weight. The batteries do not last ver long, so it would not be useful for a large yard. However, the batteries are interchangeable with other 40V Blak+Decker appliances. So, if you have the matching trimmer, blower, ..., this is a great option. I have a large yard and a riding mower and this mower is perfect for the parts of the yard I can't get withe the rider because the are too steep or too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jamsmith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light duty lawn groomer for elderly woman who still loves to do her own yard work!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on schedule. Easy to assemble (be sure to READ ALL INSTRUCTIONS before assembling and operating). Both batteries charged up with an hour, and are easily installed/released in the mower battery port. I was able to start mowing within an hour of receiving it. This mower is lightweight and user friendly, and I was able to groom my small lawn (40'x60') with finesse! I am an elderly woman, and can no longer "pull start" my old heavy duty lawn tools, so this is perfect. I can still get my exercise, while continuing to do my own yard work. I hope it's performance holds up to its 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: The short battery time may be an issue for some
customer_reviews.text: Now, they tell you right up front that it runs for about 30 minutes (a little less if you have heavy coverage). There is no side outlet so you either have to use the catch bag or lift the mower up periodically to avoid clogs. I love how light it is, and the batteries go in and out easily. Pretty simple, which is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Trish Telesco

customer_reviews.title: Happy we converted over
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace our gas mower. We love the ease of use. No gas, no oil, no smelly fumes, no cord pulling and finicky starts. The noise is so minimal that I'm not bothered at all by my husband mowing the lawn near the house and our cat is content to stay where he is outside. We have three battery packs. One came with the purchase of a B&D trimmer/weed whacker and blower combo. We use a total of 4 battery changes to finish our medium-sized yard including blowing and trimming. Easy doing by starting with 3 fully charged and the first one charging after changing out. Happy with this purchase and good for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Tsuki

customer_reviews.title: Used it for the first time today I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today I have a smaller yard and it does OK it drains the batteries and stalls on tall grass luckily I had a third battery that goes to my weed whacker so I could finish I'm confident the next time will go easier since the grass won't be as high or damp
customer_reviews.author: The Sherins

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't hold charge.  Very difficult to cut grass
customer_reviews.text: Bought in March and now it is June and am having difficult time cutting grass. Have wheels set high to make grass cutting easy but does not help much. Cut grass weekly but becoming more difficult since battery does not have enough juice to cut grass. Rotate between two batteries which came with the mower but neither does a great job when cutting thicker grass. Very disappointed in product.
customer_reviews.author: walter duvall

customer_reviews.title: Vastly underpowered
customer_reviews.text: Vastly underpowered, if it hits the smallest of sticks or high grass it dies. I had to restart at least 50 times and clear it 10 times just to mow my front lawn. Drained both batteries on a 60X40 lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pheil

customer_reviews.title: My experience wasn’t great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower with high hopes as I have several Black and Decker products. Unfortunately, it didn’t live up to its expectations and had to be returned. Will have to go and get another one now ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Philly fan

customer_reviews.title: Bag doesn't stay on.
customer_reviews.text: The bag does not stay on the mower. I often end up holding it as I zip around my lawn. Very bad design, since it appears that the blower blows grass mostly over the bag, through the space between the bag and mower cover, and not to the back of the bag. This blower interaction causes the bag to fall off. I love it otherwise, but it is a really big pain to keep putting the bag on or hold on to it. If you're not bagging the grass clippings, then no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie K

customer_reviews.title: ... about 35 years and wasn't sure if I would like cordless. This works quite well for me as ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used corded electric for about 35 years and wasn't sure if I would like cordless. This works quite well for me as my front and back yard are not that large and it cuts nicely. It has more vacuum action than my B&D Lawn Hog but nothing compares the the Craftsman (made by B&D) in 1980. The grass catcher is harder to get off and on than my other ones. Being so narrow a cut makes it hard to keep a straight line. But going from corded to cordless is fantastic. I spend as much time mowing my yard now as I used to spend untangling the extension cord and winding it back up. How good is that?
customer_reviews.author: Coolswede

customer_reviews.title: it's
customer_reviews.text: A decent battery powered mower, gets the job done - enough power to chop thru some hefty (2.5" thick) trunks. On a dry day it'll clear my back yard on 1.5 charges, my front on .5 ~ 1. With wet grass it takes 3 full batteries to clear my backyard. My only gripes - if you have bumpy terrain look out for the hub caps coming off; the handle _seems_ a little flimsy with everything tightened but it holds.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Surprised... mows with plenty of power typically on only one battery charge, but nice to know we have two batteries. Only drawback is width, means more passes over lawn. Good so far’
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The mower works great but the plastic fairing on the left front of the mower where the wheel connects was broken/cracked when i received it. I didn't realize this until after I assembled it and mowed maybe a 10' test strip of my lawn. The mower works great so far and the battery handles my whole lawn without changing (about 25 minutes of mowing). Performance is not an issue. However, customer service told me I could not return this for a new unit as it as now "used".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible B+D customer support experience
customer_reviews.text: Even though the product is ok, I'm rating with one star due to the terrible customer support experience that I had with Black+Decker. I contacted B+D due to the inconsistency in the product description between Amazon and their site. According to B+D, this product has mulching capabilities, which, according to them you need to buy an accessory that doesn't exist. I also sent an email to B+D several days ago without a response. I won't ever buy any B+D product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DanielC

customer_reviews.title: Handy machine...
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving this machine. Other than mowing our small lawn is now my job...The battery lasts thru one mowing, with just a little left over, but I have two batteries and keep one on the charger at all times. It's a snap to change the battery and empty the basket. If it just lasts, I'll be super pleased. I have several B+D 18 volt tools and am happy with them all, now that they've gone to lithium...
customer_reviews.author: BonnieJ

customer_reviews.title: low quality battery
customer_reviews.text: The batteries last less than 10 minutes after 1 month use....... And after the battery runs out, you cannot charge it immediately because it is too hot and the charger has red light blinking. I always need to wait at least 40 minutes before I can charge it........so disappointed. I wish I know how to return in easily....
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: MOWING FUN
customer_reviews.text: I just used this mower for the first time, I can actually say this mower puts the fun back in mowing. It's light, easy to handle and very quiet. I mowed my 2500 sq ft yard with 8" wet grass with ease. I would highly recommend this mower to anyone. Electric is the way to go.... and NO cord. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: D Stead

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed at this little mower
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at this little mower! I have a small yard and I'm 61 years old. This thing gets right to work. Very easy to maneuver. Charge holds well. One thing I really like is the vent they placed on the grass catcher bag. When you turn the mower on the vent pops up. When it gets full of grass the vent lowers so you know when to empty the bag. Sweet. I've been using electric mowers for 40 years. Thank goodness the cord is gone! My grass cutting time has been cut in half.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Please READ before you purchase
customer_reviews.text: After only using this 4 times, each battery that was supposed to last 20-25 minutes each lasted 10 minutes each. Also the mower came without a black plastic washer that allows the two handles to connect tightly, had to order that. Finally, after 3 uses the cable that attaches the push button box to the dead-man handle broke. Needless to say a lot of inconvenience for a hig-end cordless lawn mower...not worth the head-ache. Regards, Gary
customer_reviews.author: Gary Nations,Sr

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues?
customer_reviews.text: First time trying to use the mower, with fully charged battery, mower starts and promptly dies after 4-5 seconds. Same happened with other battery. Trying for a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lane Cowin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Mower
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower!!! I wore my other mower out, the same one. It’s light, easy to handle and battery operated. Perfect for women! It’s fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer!

customer_reviews.title: No Power
customer_reviews.text: This mower is fine for a nice fescue. If you have a thick Saint Augustine, you'll need more power. The St. Augustine stops it dead.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Philip Masi

customer_reviews.title: Will not start
customer_reviews.text: Assembled this mower three days ago with the help of neighbors, one of whom is an electrical engineer. The mower simply will not start. Directions for troubleshooting were followed; both batteries were fully charged, and and each was inserted properly, but the mower still will not start. I have been instructed to take it to a repair center.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: Definitely 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice mower super light ,well built very very quiet would definitely recommend you get 2 batteries 1 charger just a really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: justin stickley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy something that will actually work! It couldn’t even cut our lawn after assembling it the first time. Battery was fully charged, the mower just kept shutting itself off. We will be returning and buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver, does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Batteries are much lighter than my old 36V. The charge lasts longer than needed to cut front and back lawns. Mower cuts through weed patches without a problem, and the lawn looks nicely and evenly trimmed when I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Prana

customer_reviews.title: I love this mower.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product! Holds a charge well, cuts through grass, weeds, small branches, etc. Easy to lift if you have a terraced yard like my own. the varying heights work great. the batteries are easy to switch out and charge. It starts super easily, and the safety key is perfect for those with children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 summers
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little mower. It lasted almost 6 years! The plastic bits started to have trouble where the screws go in for the handle. Guess I’ll be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this!!! Waste of money. Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt even deserve a star. This lawnmower is a waste of money. It dies the whole time. The battery lasts 15 mins then u have to wait for the battery to cool down enough to recharge it. Its not even easy gliding and u literally have to push it with force to move. Dont buy it it isnt worth it at all!!! Highly dissapointed and if i could send it back i would. The bag needs changing begore the battery dies because its capacity is the lowest ive seen. Ugh! A total waste of $300
customer_reviews.author: Micah Sneeringer

customer_reviews.title: Great little mower
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lawnmower. It's easy to change the battery, plus it comes with an extra in case one runs out of power mid-lawn. We have a small yard, so it is perfect for us. I use it without the bag; it does leave some clumps of grass but they are very well mulched. Much easier to use than my old electric one which needed a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and operate. It’s a little light and took some time to get use to, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kbyrne

customer_reviews.title: In Love!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have made in years! Works perfectly. Batteries charge quickly & love that there are 2. As a woman, this is really easy to build, handle & carry if necessary. Called customer service with some questions, and they couldn't have been nicer. I look forward to mowing the lawn each week. And how great is it to have it delivered right to your front door! Is it possible to be in love with your lawn mower??
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Mower
customer_reviews.text: I've never written an amazon review before, but had to this time. This mower is amazing. It was easy to assemble ( just putting the handle on), and very very easy to use. I already had a B&B weed eater, and the batteries fit in both. I used it for the first time today, and got 30 minutes from each battery. The yard was finished before the batteries were. I also love how easy it is to start. So far, it's everything I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia k

customer_reviews.title: easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: no gas, only bad thing is that the battery is hard for me to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadine Blacketer

customer_reviews.title: We most of the black and decker re-chargeable lawn sets ...
customer_reviews.text: We most of the black and decker re-chargeable lawn sets, and this one really has surpassed our expectations. It does not have the power that a gas lawnmower has.... but it certainly starts for us every single time. I was tired of buying gas powered equipment that failed season after season. This does exactly what I am needing and would be ideal for 70% of most lawns out there.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy for average or bigger lawn.
customer_reviews.text: This product is OK for small yards with short grass. I have a average size lawn and it needs too many battery changes to take care of it. I bought a Black and Decker blower and Clipper so I have three batteries to go with it. It needs all three to just take care of backyard. One of the batteries have given up in two years. Good - Light weighted can move it with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I ever expected
customer_reviews.text: This mower works great for my little yard. I used to haul an extension cord around with my electric mower traversing trees, a windmill and large firepit thinking a battery powered mower could not compete... but it was amazingly..
customer_reviews.author: Mardie D. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Honestly have no idea how the reviews are good for this product. It took me 8 batteries to cut the tiny piece of land associated with my house. Batteries charge faster than 4 hours, but how much time do you really want to put toward cutting your grass? It took me nearly 8 hours to cut less than 1/8th of an acre. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Shulkosky

customer_reviews.title: I use this on narrow sod and find it is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this light, easy to maneuver, charge my battery, empty the bag and mow any length of grass. If you buy it, you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cavallin Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Great product for smaller lawns.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard and this cordless mower works great for me. I am able to mow the entire front and back yard on a single battery (total run time around 25 minutes). It does not compare to a gas powered mower but I am very happy with this purchase for my needs. I also own Black & Decker Cordless Trimmer and Blower and these products combined together have been a good investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: psoftconsult

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed that the battery requires frequent charging before my lawn ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed that the battery requires frequent charging before my lawn is completely mowed. I would only recommend this for small lawns and make sure the grass does not grow too much, otherwise it turns itself off if it is too thick or bushy.
customer_reviews.author: Orlin

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Holds a good charge
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Holds a good charge. Thanks for two 40amp interchangeable batteries. I have a small yard and can get almost two cuts with one battery. Only downside so far is the "quick connects" for the upright foldable handle. Two quick connects attaching the lower portion to the mower are not universal to the two quick connects that fold the handle for tight storage. I'm getting a little slippage below, so I may have them reversed. Hard to tell from the instructions...really small pictures...and I'm older now. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Herschel T Parker

customer_reviews.title: It is a great mower. It does as description says
customer_reviews.text: It is a great mower. It does as description says. It stalled out when going through areas that are too thick and high but after taking the key and battery out and returning them it started just fine. Just use your trimmer on the taller stuff before mowing.
customer_reviews.author: gakette

customer_reviews.title: A Great mower and battery powered
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job. is really quiet and adjustable heights. Neighbors stop by to see if it is really working.
customer_reviews.author: RunHikenBike

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: One of the best buys... Its so convenient to have cordless mower. Feels lighter and easy to mow. Usually 1 battery charge is enough if mowing regularely. Anyways if you have B&D tools its the same standard battery / charger, so you can interchange with other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Praj

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my friend's mother who is older and having trouble starting her motor with the pull-cord. She asked for something with a button. She has a fairly normal suburban size yard, and the battery can only do the front OR the back with one charge. That being said, it's met all expectations just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Witt

customer_reviews.title: I liked it very well
customer_reviews.text: I liked it very well. My yard is just too rough. I could not push it. Have already sold it for what I paid for it. I 85 and need one that size that would be self propelled.
customer_reviews.author: Iris. E. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: It is reliable and light in weight
customer_reviews.text: It is a perfect mower that I have ever used. It is light in weight and easy to use. it is powerful enough to mow the lawn easily. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Easy Work of Trimming Around the House
customer_reviews.text: Wow, do I love this mower. My wife wanted one, but of course, I've ended up using it (I'm so manly and all that, apparently). I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: M Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Update - It's been just over 2 years. I am very happy with mower, but batteries it comes with lasted only 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Cordless makes it very convenient, it's light easy to use. One small drawback, I find that if the battery is not fully charged the then with a little bit of moisture in grass or if the grass is a longer for your blade height then it will stall, but I find that that is not a big deal the fact that I comes with two batteries, I have one fully charged ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how well I liked this!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well I liked this! I have severe arthritis and this is so easy to operate. I had to have my son assemble it, but other than that it works marvelously!
customer_reviews.author: TamGar

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with the purchase The cons are: Only a 16 inch cutting width which makes more passes to complete and the 2 batteries that come with unit will wear down faster Rear bagging only feature Grass collection bag is on the small side which makes more trips to empty Did I mention it only comes with 2 batteries O.K. The pros are: Easy to adjust cutting height No gas to spill No tune ups No cords to pull and pull your shoulder out Quiet Easy to start up Easy to push Easy to store The cut is good as my gas powered unit The pros out weigh the cons by far
customer_reviews.author: R Atkins

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second B&D CM1640 mower. I have 1 for the front and 1 for the backyard. These are great for small yards. Always keep a spare battery charged tho and you should be fine. No more gas yard equipment...yea!
customer_reviews.author: johnboy

customer_reviews.title: good mower for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Suits my purposes very well. Not for a large lawn, but handles rough ground and doesn't stall out on thick, tall grass. Battery charge is about 1/2 hour and the second battery allows you to continue, leapfrogging the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Goode, MD

customer_reviews.title: wheel shaft missing threading. wheel comes off.
customer_reviews.text: product runs fine but when I started using it, the wheel came off repeatedly. Upon inspection I found that a nut and washer were not installed on the inside of the wheel holding it onto the wheel shaft. When I tried to install one, I found that the wheel shaft was not threaded on one of the wheels so it is not possible to attach a nut to it, which would fasten the wheel to it. I had to order and replace the wheel shaft.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good for flat grass lawns
customer_reviews.text: Good for grass and light weeds only, two batteries is great. Doesn't work great on uneven terrain, grass catcher occasionally falls off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: This mower doesn't have enough power to mow a small lawn. From the reviews I thought it would be just right but was very unhappy that it wasn't able to push through medium-height grass at a normal speed. It wouldn't stall when I pushed it very very slowly through the thicker areas, but had to raise the blade up higher than I wanted and go extremely slowly just so it would work at all. The first battery ran out of juice before I finished mowing the back yard, and the second battery wasn't able to complete the smaller front yard.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Pemov

customer_reviews.title: Definitely an easy lawn mower to use
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an easy lawn mower to use. You have the convenience of two 40v Lithium batteries that give you enough power to mow a small city lot within 1 hour of run time. Each battery fully charges within 1 hour giving you additional time in mowing a larger lot. Easy to assemble, operate, and lift at less than 40 lbs. Non-rusting housing with easy folding of handles for transport. No extension cord to run over and no cord to pull to start. It's GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! Cuts like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! Cuts like a dream, and it's extremely easy to push. I mowed about 3/4 of my lawn on one battery. I only wish that I had ordered a bigger size. Love this - I'll never go back to a push mower with gas.
customer_reviews.author: T. Box

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight and Quiet!  Wish all the neighbors used one!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, cuts and picks up well. I have other B&D tools which use 40 V batteries. So battery life (takes two for my lawn) is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chemical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mower
customer_reviews.text: Works great, great price,powerful, quiet, no chords, no fumes, and no stinky gas & oil mixing. Was able to ship vacation home with no problems to Costa Rica in original manufacturer 49 pound box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: The two batteries included do not power the mower to finish my small yard. It is very light and stores in a small area.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Carter

customer_reviews.title: Did i receive a defected mower??
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what else to say except this mower is weak. The battery last for 20 minutes tops, I can't have the lever height any less than a 5 because I go over the grass and it dies. The more it dies the quicker the battery goes too. Hey it works wonderful if you go backwards! I stopped using the bag because it fills up too fast and I ran out of space to dump the shavings so now I get grass stuck to my feet. I will be returning this, even though I'll get charged a shipping fee and lose out on money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Earth friendly
customer_reviews.text: No gas, oil, smoke or noise! Great mower, easy to use, lite weight and a nice clean cut! Great for picking up leaves in the fall with the attached bag. Two batteries charge up very quickly. Two years and very happy with this mower. Buy it a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably quick to set up. The battery gives out ...
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably quick to set up. The battery gives out within about 20 minutes with 3-week-old St.Augustine grass growth. Luckily it came with two, so no sweat.
customer_reviews.author: David Paul

customer_reviews.title: The only bad so far is the included batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this but it cuts like I'd hoped it would. The battery (LBXR2036) didn't last long. I mowed for ~45 minutes and had to use both fully charged batteries to get done what I did. I had to charge one to finish the job. Not sure if a different battery would let me finish without swapping out batteries.
customer_reviews.author: JON

customer_reviews.title: Overheating batteries that need lots of charging
customer_reviews.text: Great lawnmower, but you will need to buy a few more batteries in order to finish your lawn in one day. The batteries dies out and need to be recharged and cannot be charged until they cool down because they overheat.
customer_reviews.author: dawn

customer_reviews.title: One of my greatest purchases ever
customer_reviews.text: One of my greatest purchases ever! I actually enjoy mowing my lawn now! For those saying the battery doesn't last long, that's bull. I can mow my large front lawn and 3 very small lawns in my backyard, all with ONE battery! It's also great because I can easily carry it down stairs! Freakin awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Great mower. While it doesn't hold up power for power for a gas mower, it gets the job done. I found that the 9.5 gallon tiny bag was cute and was in the way and that caused the mower to decline in performance since the grass had nowhere to shoot out to. So I got one of my plastic clamps I use to keep plywood in place when I saw and clamped open the shoot. (If you have rocks in your yard, I don't recommend this) It increased my mower performance and I didn't have to worry about changing the bag every minute. I wish the mower was side discharged from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Who fixes my Black & Decker mower?
customer_reviews.text: The handle does not attach tightly and the grass catcher falls off making it unusable. Most frustrating is having no where to go to fix these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jody B. Olson

customer_reviews.title: It’s like vacuuming your yard! I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Now I only used it for the first time yesterday but it did great! Easy to use batteries charged quickly. With the bag attachment and the sound, so quiet, I felt like I was vacuuming my yard. Fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Short run tim
customer_reviews.text: Battery run time is 15 minutes at the most. Expected more after using other B and D cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: I feel itll last, and i hear my neighbor mowing there grass over the sound of mine
customer_reviews.text: Cuts my yard of 5000 square feet almost completely on one battery, comes with two....the bag might not last forever, but I'm sure their customer service would replace it, they replaced parts of mine, love it, and I use it hard
customer_reviews.author: Eric

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER CM1640 40V MAX Cordless Lawn Mower,
product_meta.description:
Style:40V Cordless Lawn Mower Kit

Lightweight, easy to maneuver, and no cords (view larger). Designed for cutting efficiency and the freedom of cordless convenience, the Black & Decker CM1640 16-Inch Cordless Mower is ideal for smaller yards up to 1/8 of an acre. Weighing only 38 pounds, the CM1640 cordless mower is lightweight, compact, and easy to maneuver for great cutting results with minimal effort. It's powered by Black & Decker's 40-volt MAX lithium-ion battery system, and the two included batteries combine to give you up to 30 minutes of mowing. 

EASY STARTING
The CM1640 cordless mower easily starts with just a push of a button, and is a smart, no-mess, no-hassle alternative to gas powered lawn mowers. You'll save time by eliminating the frustration of pull cords, the hassle of mixing gas and oil, as well as trips to the gas station and engine maintenance.

Handle folds down for convenient storage (view larger). CUTTING CONVENIENCE
The CM1640 features a cutting height range of 1 to 3 inches and a handy single lever height adjustment raises or lowers all four wheels simultaneously. When beginning to mow, the motor makes a smooth start and then easily tackles thick grass or uneven cutting terrain.

The 16-inch deck is ideal for smaller yards, and the durable and lightweight cutting deck never rusts, and is easy to clean. The soft fabric of the grass bag allows for easy checking by tapping the bag from the bottom to see if it is full. For convenient storage, the mower's handles fold down and over the mower so it fits nicely in small spaces in sheds or garages. Carrying handles on the mower make it easy to lift and carry.

40-VOLT MAX CORDLESS POWER
Get ready to experience the new Black & Decker 40-volt MAX lithium-ion batteries.1 They provide up to 33 percent increased battery pack capacity on single charge2 and are fully compatible with Black & Decker's 36-volt lithium-ion system, which include a string trimmer, hedge trimmer, sweeper vac, and a sweeper/blower vac. The battery is easily removed with the click of a button and conveniently recharges in the garage or shed via the included charger.

The 40V MAX* system offers you the power and performance you need to get the job done. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
CM1640 16-inch cordless mower, two 40-volt batteries (LBXR2040), charger (LCS36), operating instructions

ABOUT BLACK & DECKER
Since 1910, Black & Decker has been setting the standard for innovation and design of power tools, accessories, outdoor yard care equipment, home cleaning products, automotive and lighting products, hardware, and other home improvement products. The inventor of the first portable electric drill with pistol grip and trigger switch, Black & Decker has evolved from a small machine shop in Baltimore, Maryland, to a global manufacturing and marketing powerhouse with a broad line of quality products used in and around the home and for commercial applications. When users need to get work done, they trust Black & Decker for the products that will do the job efficiently and reliably.


1. Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without workload) is 40 volts; nominal is 36. 
2. Using the new 40-volt MAX lithium-ion 2.0 Ah battery versus the 40-volt MAX lithium-ion 1.5 Ah battery.

CM1640 16-INCH CORDLESS MOWER, 40-VOLT
AT A GLANCE
 * Comes with two 40-volt MAX lithium-ion batteries (2.0 Ah) for up to 30 minutes of runtime
 * 16-inch compact deck ideal for yards up to 1/8 acre
 * Folding handles for easy and convenient storage in sheds and small spaces
 * Carrying handle makes it easy to lift and carry
 * 9.5 gallon grass bag with soft fabric and hard top enables you to check if grass box is full
 * Six adjustable height settings with range of 1-1/5-inch to 3-1/5-inch


Easy battery change (view larger). 
Swap batteries with the rest of the 40-volt MAX cordless lineup (view larger). 

BRAND STORY
By Black & Decker
feature_bullets: Height Adjust- 6 settings, with a height of cut between 1-1/10" and 3-1/10"
Folding handles for easy & convenient storage
9.5 gallon grass box designed with a soft fabric with hard top. Included Components: (2) LBXR2040 batteries, (1) LCS36 charger; Power Source: Battery

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars495 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
